page.title: 08TOURISM
page.content: Since the National Park was first opened many people from all over the world have visited the area.The main attraction of the area are the hills and the river.Most of the visitors come from SE Northumberland, many of whom are regular visitors.There are many easy footpaths for ramblers,in fact there is evidence of over-use and erosion of some of the more popular routes.Other popular stops include St Michael's Church -which is usually open,the information centre ,the river and the many Ancient British settlements in the area.Very little additional employment is produced in the area from tourism.
